resources.string: The Great Pyramid of Giza is a defining symbol of Egypt and the last of the ancient Seven Wonders of the World. It is located on the Giza plateau near the modern city of Cairo and was built over a twenty-year period during the reign of the king Khufu.

The Egyptian Museum is home to an extensive collection of ancient Egyptian antiquities. It has 120,000 items, with a representative amount on display, the remainder in storerooms. The edifice is one of the largest museums in the region.

i. The Saladin Citadel of Cairo is a medieval Islamic fortification in Cairo, Egypt. The location, on Mokattam hill near the center of Cairo, was once famous for its fresh breeze and grand views of the city. It is now a preserved historic site, with mosques and museums. In 1976, it was proclaimed by UNESCO as a part of the World Heritage Site.

i. The Sultan Hassan Mosque is a massive mosque and school located in the Old city of Cairo, it was built during the Mamluk Islamic era in Egypt. At the time of construction the mosque was considered remarkable for its fantastic size and innovative architectural components.

Al-Azhar Park is a public park located in Cairo, Egypt. Among several honors, this park is listed as one of the world\'s sixty great public spaces by the Project for Public Spaces (PPS). It’s commanding stunning panoramic views of the world's most intriguing city. Al-Azhar Park offers every visitor a glimpse into the captivating past.

The Japanese gardens are a feature of the town (Helwan). They must have been laid out years ago but they are still lovely containing as they do a number of fish ponds, numerous walks which are surmounted by arbours, which are or rather were probably used as tea garden shelters from the sun

This park has International in its name because some of its flowers, trees, and animals originate from different countries around the world. One of its entrances has flags of the countries that are represented in the garden.

The Aquarium Grotto Garden—also called El Gabalaya Garden after the name of the street where it is located Unique for its architectural beauty, the garden’s formations are made of clay to look like fish gills. The Aquarium Grotto Garden has many underground grottoes that used to host various unique types of fish from the Nile and other places.

i. Chili\'s Grill is an American casual dining restaurant chain that features Tex-Mex-style cuisine. You can enjoy having your lunch/dinner while enjoying the fabulous view of the Nile river and the nice atmosphere.

An oriental cuisine infused with Egyptian and Levant flavours and subtle combination of spices. Bab Al Qasr sets the stage for an authentic dinner in ambient surroundings, accented with belly dance performances on selected nights.
Above the central plateau of Al-Mokattam mountain, you can enjoy the grilled and barbecued meat and chicken made by an innovative way taken from the Bedouin people called "Al-Mandi"
You can enjoy the variety of Grilled meat and chickens along side the great atmosphere in the heart of the historical places and mosques
You can enjoy having a cruise in the Nile river and watching the monuments like Cairo Tower with some fresh air and nice atomsphere

Sandboarding is a boardsport and extreme sport. It is a recreational activity and takes place on sand dunes. It involves riding across or down a dune while standing with both feet strapped to a board. Sandboarding can also be practised sitting down or lying on the belly or the back.
Gaber Ibn Hayan St., Dokki, Giza, Egypt

Like Crystal Maze in the 90’s, our rooms will provide an interactive experience where teams race against time to ESCAPE the room by finding clues based on various scenarios to solve live puzzles within 60 minutes. We have designed the experience to appeal to different age groups and all backgrounds.
A new funny version of Football games, as you wear a huge transparent plastic ball along with your team and start bumping and bouncing with a lot of laughing.
